headers.subject: [tosdr:2224] Terms may be changed at any time, but you will be notified.

html:
They can change the terms of service any time they see fit, but they will notify the user. Your use of the service supposedly constitutes acceptance of the changes in the terms.

An exception can be made in case of changes due to administrative or legal reasons which do not constitute material change according to the service provider. However, when the notification is sent with a reasonable advance, it is a different case.

This applies to many services:
  • Flattr https://groups.google.com/d/topic/tosdr/Lr7slMNcBxI/discussion
    “Flattr reserves the right to modify or replace at its sole discretion the Terms at any time. Flattr will notify all Flattr users of any changes to the Terms via the Flattr system and email. You will be responsible for reviewing and becoming familiar with any such modifications. Use of the Service or the Flattr Site by you following such notification constitutes your acceptance of the Terms as modified. We encourage you to periodically check the Flattr Site for any changes to the Terms.”
  • Dropbox https://groups.google.com/d/topic/tosdr/td68YSswb-w/discussion
    “If a revision, in our sole discretion, is material we will notify you (for example via email to the email address associated with your account).”
  • 500px https://groups.google.com/d/topic/tosdr/uPk0rmk6_1w/discussion
    “500px reserves the right, at its sole discretion, to modify or replace the terms at any time. If the alterations constitute a material change to the terms, 500px will notify you by Posting an announcement on the site. What constitutes a material change will be Determined at 500px’s sole discretion.” 
Please  post here about services which have identical clauses.

--
tosdr.org | twitter.com/tosdr | github.com/tosdr

subject: Terms may be changed at any time, but you will be notified.
text:
They can change the terms of service *any time* they see fit, but they *will 
notify* the user. Your *use* of the service supposedly *constitutes 
acceptance* of the changes in the terms.

An exception can be made in case of changes due to administrative or legal 
reasons which do not constitute material change according to the service 
provider. However, when the notification is sent with a reasonable advance, 
it is a different case.

This applies to many services:

   - Flattr https://groups.google.com/d/topic/tosdr/Lr7slMNcBxI/discussion 
   
>    “Flattr reserves the right to modify or replace at its sole discretion 
>    the Terms at any time. Flattr will notify all Flattr users of any changes 
>    to the Terms via the Flattr system and email. You will be responsible for 
>    reviewing and becoming familiar with any such modifications. Use of the 
>    Service or the Flattr Site by you following such notification constitutes 
>    your acceptance of the Terms as modified. We encourage you to periodically 
>    check the Flattr Site for any changes to the Terms.”
   
   - Dropbox https://groups.google.com/d/topic/tosdr/td68YSswb-w/discussion 
   
>    “If a revision, in our sole discretion, is material we will notify you 
>    (for example via email to the email address associated with your account).”
   
   - 500px https://groups.google.com/d/topic/tosdr/uPk0rmk6_1w/discussion 
   
>    “500px reserves the right, at its sole discretion, to modify or 
>    replace the terms at any time. If the alterations constitute a material

>    sole discretion.”
